meanings.definition: To make or become red in color.
meanings.sent1: The sun reddens the sky during sunset.
meanings.sent2: Her cheeks reddens when she feels shy.
meanings.sent3: The tomato reddens as it ripens on the vine.
meanings.sent4: The anger in his voice reddens the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The fiery chili pepper reddens the dish with its spice.

meanings.definition: To blush or flush with embarrassment or anger.
meanings.sent1: She reddens when caught in a lie.
meanings.sent2: He reddens with frustration when things don't go his way.
meanings.sent3: The embarrassed student reddens as he realizes his mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks reddens like a rose in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: His face reddens with anger as he argues with his friend.
